intro: Abrodictyum brassii, commonly known as the blue orchid, is a rare and striking member of the orchid family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its unique, deep blue petals and a fragrant, intricate flower structure. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires specific soil conditions to flourish. Due to its rarity and beauty, it is highly sought after by botanists and orchid enthusiasts alike.
distribution_native_art_desc: Abrodictyum brassii is primarily native to the eastern and southern regions of Brazil. It is found in the states of Minas Gerais, Espírito Santo, and Rio de Janeiro. This plant typically grows in humid, tropical forests and is often associated with rocky or shaded areas. It is part of the Orchidaceae family and is known for its striking, colorful flowers. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
